boat.construction_details: GRP isopthalic resin. Epoxy coated ( 3 coats) from new. 2014, 2 further epoxy coats applied and 4 coats Coppercoat epoxy antifouling applied.

for_sales.sales_text:
A tough small GRP cruiser, designed by John Leather and inspired by Colin Archer, "Sula" has sailed to Norway and to Morocco.

The hull was epoxy coated from new (1997) and has had 2 further epoxy coats in 2014 prior to Coppercoat antifouling. Sleeps four in two cabins, she is cosy below with a good galley, keel cooled ridge and Taylors heater for cold nights. The GRP hull is easy to maintain and of proven pedigree. An excellent sea boat.

boat.full_description:
Sula's design by John Leather was inspired by the designs of Colin Archer. She has cruised to Norway, Holland, France, Spain, Portugal and Morocco, being based in Portugal for many years.

Her engine was rebuilt with new head and piston rings in 2014. The hull epoxy coated from new, she had two further epoxy coats in 2014 prior to applying Coppercoat antifouling which should last until 2024.

Her running rigging is continuously replaced and standing rigging, 8mm galvanized, stored in linseed oil evey winter. The jib has a new UV strip and the 55W flexi solar panel mounted on the forehatch just about keeps up with the keel cooled fridge.

She's a very comfortable small cruiser whether hove-to, sitting out a F8 off the Norwegian coast or at anchor on the Algarve coast. A great sea boat with a proven pedigree.

In 2016, she was sold in Portugal and is now based in the Netherlands.

In 2017 she had a new Beta marine 25 HP Diesel engine.
boat.name: Sula of Maldon

ownerships.note: 1st owner Jim Spencer. 2nd owner D Barten.

boat.short_description: 'Sula of Maldon', built in 1997, is a Kattegat Class designed by John Leather and inspired by Colin Archer.
